headline: Zamfara Assembly orders Chief judge to set up panel to investigate deputy Gov. -
summarized_story:
The Zamfara State House of Assembly has directed the state Chief Justice to set up investigative panel on the alleged gross misconduct leveled against the state Deputy Governor Mahdi Aliyu Gusau.
The House during it’s 120 Plenary unanimously agreed that the Deputy Governor be investigated for breaching Sections 190 and 193 (1), (2) (a)(b)(c) of the Constitution of the Federal Republic of Nigeria.
AdvertisementThis Development is coming barely twenty four hours after the House served all members with Notice of Impeachment of the Deputy GovernorEighteen out of the twenty two members of the House voted for in favour of the motionAdvertisementThe only PDP Lawmaker representing Zurmi East Salihu Usman was also not present at the plenaryThe Zamfara assembly is accusing the deputy of abuse of office, saying he has breached sections 190 and 193 (1), (2) (a)(b)(c) of the ConstitutionAdvertisementThe Zamfara State House of Assembly had on Monday through the Secretary to the state government served the deputy Governor an impeachment noticeA federal high court in Abuja had in November last year restrained the Zamfara Assembly from any move to impeach the deputy GovernorAdvertisementThe crisis between the Zamfara Assembly and deputy Governor started a few weeks after the formal Defection of Governor Bello Matawalle from the People’s Democratic Party to the ruling APC.

headline: Bagudu swears-in 21 LG chairmen, asks them to develop grassroot potential -
summarized_story:
The newly elected chairmen and vice chairmen of the twenty one local government areas of Kebbi state have been advised to pay attention to the economic potential and other opportunities in their various domain.
Kebbi state governor, Atiku Bagudu gave the advised shortly after the elected council officials took their oath of office at a ceremony held at Birnin Kebbi.
AdvertisementHe says the council executives should also be interested in how those economic potential can be developed and explore for the benefit of the nation and their immediate environment.
The governor said, with the oath of office administered on them, partisanship should be kept aside and work for the entirety of the people of the local government irrespective of political party affiliation.
AdvertisementThe twenty one council chairmen and their vice chairmen are all of the All Progressives Congress APC and sixteen of the twenty and fifty five councillors elected across the twenty one.local government, sixteen of them are women.

headline: Ahead of 2023 Elections, Buhari Warns Foreign Diplomats About Meddling in Nigeria’s Internal Politics
summarized_story:
For the umpteenth time, President Muhammadu Buhari has warned foreign diplomats against meddling in the internal politics of Nigeria as the nation prepares for the 2023 general elections.
This was the second time in five months that the president would be asking diplomats to steer clear of nation’s local politics.
Buhari urged the Ambassadors to build lasting friendships in the course of performing their duties that will go beyond assignments in Nigeria.
Buhari assured of partnership and mutual cooperation in canvassing more Foreign Direct Investments (FDI) in healthcare system, education, infrastructure, local manufacturing, pharmaceuticals, agribusiness and transportation.
Krejc said the envoys would work for the development of Nigeria, through strengthening of mutual and beneficial relations with their countries.

headline: Buhari Still Consulting on Electoral Bill, Aide Says
summarized_story:
The Senior Special Assistant to President Muhammadu Buhari, on National Assembly Matters (Senate), Senator Babajide Omoworare, on Thursday said his principal had yet to sign the 2010 Electoral Act (Amendment) Bill 2022 because he was still consulting with stakeholders and legal experts on the issue.
They spoke at a Policy Dialogue programme, organised by the National Institute for Legislative and Democratic Studies (NILDS).
He said, “A very crucial consultation is going on between Mr. President, the Attorney General and other critical stakeholders on content of the bill for the required assent.
Malami had during an interview on Channels Television hinted that President Muhammadu Buhari may withhold assent, if the bill was considered to have proposals based on personal interests.
He added that if the nation was serious about advancing democracy, then people should stop playing to the gallery and do what the public interest says.

headline: Nigeria’s Oil Production Rises by 202,000bpd
summarized_story:
According to the OPEC’s Monthly Oil Market Report (MOMR) for January released on Thursday, the country struggled to pump 1.399 million bpd out of the total allocation, quoting primary sources.
RelatedStories No Content AvailableThis was in contrast to December 2021, when it pumped 1.197 million barrels per day and November when it was only able to produce 1.275 million bpd.
Even top producer, Saudi Arabia, failed to deliver its 110,000 bpd monthly increase, raising its oil production in January by 54,000 bpd to 9.999 million, below its 10.122 million bpd quota for January per the OPEC+ deal.
Despite tightening oil market, OPEC and its allies, OPEC+ has continued to add a measured 400,000 barrels per day increase in production to the market.
It left its demand outlook for global oil demand growth unchanged, while signalling optimism about prospective increases in transport fuel consumption.

headline: CBN Eyes $200bn from Fresh Non-Oil Exports
summarized_story:
The Governor of the Central Bank of Nigeria (CBN), Mr. Godwin Emefiele, on Thursday announced a new programme to stimulate the country’s non-oil exports and achieve $200 billion repatriation of proceeds between three to five years.
Emefiele said the scheme, code-named, “Race to $200 billion in FX Repatriation (RT200 FX Programme),” which takes immediate effect, consists of a set of policies, plans and programmes for non-oil exports which would help the country attain its goal of $200 billion in FX repatriation, exclusively from non-oil exports transactions over the next three to five years.
He, however, explained that the new non-oil export initiative would have five key anchors namely value-adding exports facility; Non-oil commodities’ expansion facility; Non-oil FX rebate scheme; Dedicated non-oil export terminal as well as Biannual non-oil export summit.
“Fund people who want to generate export proceeds, when those export proceeds come, we would fund them at five per cent for you and they would earn rebate and that’s how we can help you.
That you will continue to come to central bank to give you dollar, we would stop it.

headline: Nigeria’s Debt Sustainability at Risk, Cause for Concern, IMF Says
summarized_story:
The International Monetary Fund (IMF) has said Nigeria’s debt sustainability is at risk and causes a great deal of concern and unease in the long-term.
Rahman noted that the increase in public debt had grown rapidly in 10 years and was approaching a time when the country would spend all its income on servicing debts.
Rahman explained, “But what we should remember here and the things that make Nigeria’s debt sustainability at risk are the following: we have seen a rapid rise in public debt in the last 10 years or so and this is being driven by fiscal deficits.
And there are a couple of other points that we should remember; which is that Nigeria’s debt carrying capacity is very low.
So that makes Nigeria quite vulnerable.”Rahman said going forward, IMF projected for Nigeria a continuous increase in public debt.
